item.title: Java IDE written in java
item.dc:creator: @J_a_v_a_a J a v a a
item.description:
@J_a_v_a_a wrote:

Haha, slightly drunk and I have a few more than one in the fridge :).

Oh it’s because you’re creating a new line for the brace which should actually be on the same line ex… public static void main(String[] args) {

Or … ex …

if (/some condition/) {

I was assuming people followed the java code conventions. I’ll fix it tomorrow.

item.title: Java IDE written in java
item.dc:creator: @J_a_v_a_a J a v a a
item.description:
@J_a_v_a_a wrote:

Your input is that you want to decompile my code to fix my program, so you can do … what with it?

If not to use it then what? Are you going to re-release it as your own?

Read full topic

item.title: Java IDE written in java
item.dc:creator: @J_a_v_a_a J a v a a
item.description:
@J_a_v_a_a wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=J a v a a link=topic=470213.msg3439131#msg3439131 date=1292975388]
And rename all the method’s and data members?
[/quote]And deobfuscation would fix it?[/quote]

Lmao no, you would end up with methods that look like this.

private static int sub_2374(int i) { int j = 0; int k = (1 << i) - 1; if(i > var_2354) { i -= var_2354; j = var_1dd4[var_234c++] << i & k; var_2354 = 32; } var_2354 -= i; j |= var_1dd4[var_234c] >> var_2354 & (1 << i) - 1; j &= k; return j; }

It’s what they had to do for the rsps client but why waste the time on my ‘lame’ IDE? There are clearly better IDE’s out there to use if you’re so interested.

Read full topic

item.title: Java IDE written in java

Can a mod prune my thread? I don’t want this spam in here.

Main purpose - show what I’ve done.

Secondary purpose - get possible feedback from interested folks.

You’re not interested in my program and only here to argue with me. Please leave the thread.
[/quote]I’d be interested if it was open source. (and so would a lot of other people)

Can you explain why you are not releasing open source?[/quote]
I’m half tempted to decompile the entire thing, and fix errors.

item.title: Java IDE written in java
item.dc:creator: @J_a_v_a_a J a v a a
item.description:
@J_a_v_a_a wrote:

Also wanted to mention that it has support for drag and drop and opening multiple files at once.

You can open entire folders by dragging them onto the tab menu, or by selecting a folder and hitting open from the regular open menu.

Read full topic

item.title: Java IDE written in java
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

God everyone here is a moron besides a few people.

Even if this was open-source it’d probably not be worth looking at, considering J a v a a posted on MITB asking what the return type of a void is.

I do commend your efforts on creating an IDE, but why not create something that’s going to be more of use to you? There’s already plenty of IDE’s that work perfectly fine. Create something you can make money off of. Obviously, if you’ve done most of the work on this program, you do have some potential.

Example… I’ve created a few programs, one being an email-generator for a spam company that’s trying to sell airplanes:

This application was very simple to make and I gained experience and a little cash for building it.

Anyways, if you’re looking for feedback, post your source code, otherwise, don’t ask for feedback.

Adam

Read full topic

item.title: Java IDE written in java
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“J a v a a, post:32, topic:374228”]I took out the two pieces of code that were under the GPL.

I don’t need to release it open source.

If you aren’t going to use my program I don’t care. However, if someone does use it and give some feedback it would be appreciated. <-- why I posted this thread. There was already someone who posted feedback saying the compiling and such didn’t work. That was what I was trying to possibly get.

This thread was more to show a bit of what I’ve done, rather than try to get help on my program.[/quote]Why are you being such a hypocrite…
You say you posted the thread to get feedback on you, and then you say you posted it to show it off…
